item.title: Enable Harvester addons and check deployment state
item.description:
• Related issues: #5337 [BUG] Failed to enable vm-importer, pcidevices and harvester-seeder controller addons, keep stuck in “Enabling” state

Category:

  • Addons

Verification Steps

  1. Prepare three nodes Harvester cluster
  2. Open Advanced -> Addons page
  3. Access to harvester node machine
  4. Switch to root user and open k9s
  5. Enable the vm-importer, pci-devices and harvester-seeder addons
  6. Check the corresponding jobs and logs
  7. Enable rest of the addons nvidia-driver-toolkit, rancher-monitoring and rancher-logging

Expected Results

  • Check the vm-importer, pci-devices and harvester-seeder display in Deployment Successful
  • Check the vm-importer-controller, pci-devices-controller and harvester-seeder jobs and the related helm-install chart job all running well on the K9s
  • Check the nvidia-driver-toolkit, rancher-monitoring and rancher-logging display in Deployment Successful
  • Check the nvidia-driver-toolkit, rancher-monitoring and rancher-logging jobs and the related helm-install chart job all running well on the K9s

item.title: PCI Devices Controller
item.description:
Pre-requisite Enable PCI devices

  1. Create a harvester cluster in bare metal mode. Ensure one of the nodes has NIC separate from the management NIC
  2. Go to the management interface of the new cluster
  3. Go to Advanced -> PCI Devices
  4. Validate that the PCI devices aren’t enabled
  5. Click the link to enable PCI devices
  6. Enable PCI devices in the linked addon page
  7. Wait for the status to change to Deploy successful
  8. Navigate to the PCI devices page
  9. Validate that the PCI devices page is populated/populating with PCI devices

Case 1 (PCI NIC passthrough)

  1. Create a harvester cluster in bare metal mode. Ensure one of the nodes has NIC separate from the management NIC
  2. Go to the management interface of the new cluster
  3. Go to Advanced -> PCI Devices
  4. Check the box representing the PCI NIC device (identify it by the Description or the VendorId/DeviceId combination)
  5. Click Enable Passthrough
  6. When the NIC device is in an Enabled state, create a VM
  7. After creating the VM, edit the Config
  8. In the “PCI Devices” section, click the “Available PCI Devices” dropdown
  9. Select the PCI NIC device that has been enabled for passthrough
  10. Click Save
  11. Start the VM
  12. Once the VM is booted, run lspci at the command line (make sure the VM has the pciutils package) and verify that the PCI NIC device shows up
  13. (Optional) Install the driver for your PCI NIC device (if it hasn’t been autoloaded)

Case 1 dependencies:

  • PCI NIC separate from management network
  • Enable PCI devices

Case 2 (GPU passthrough)

Case 2-1 Add GPU

  1. Create a harvester cluster in bare metal mode. Ensure one of the nodes has a GPU separate from the management NIC
  2. Go to the management interface of the new cluster
  3. Go to Advanced -> PCI Devices
  4. Check the box representing the GPU device (identify it by the Description or the VendorId/DeviceId combination)
  5. Click Enable Passthrough
  6. When the GPU device is in an Enabled state, create a VM
  7. After creating the VM, edit the Config
  8. In the “PCI Devices” section, click the “Available PCI Devices” dropdown
  9. Select the GPU device that has been enabled for passthrough
  10. Click Save
  11. Start the VM
  12. Once the VM is booted, run lspci at the command line (make sure the VM has the pciutils package) and verify that the GPU device shows up
  13. Install the driver for your GPU device
    1. if the device is from NVIDIA: (this is for ubuntu, but the opensuse installation instructions are here) 
      wget https://developer.download.nvidia.com/compute/cuda/repos/wsl-ubuntu/x86_64/cuda-keyring_1.1-1_all.deb
sudo dpkg -i cuda-keyring_1.1-1_all.deb
sudo apt-get update
sudo apt-get -y install cuda nvidia-cuda-toolkit build-essential

item.title: vGPU/SR-IOV GPU
item.description:
• Related issues: #1661 vGPU Support

Pre-requisite Enable PCI devices

  1. Create a harvester cluster in bare metal mode. Ensure one of the nodes has NIC separate from the management NIC
  2. Go to the management interface of the new cluster
  3. Go to Advanced -> PCI Devices
  4. Validate that the PCI devices aren’t enabled
  5. Click the link to enable PCI devices
  6. Enable PCI devices in the linked addon page
  7. Wait for the status to change to Deploy Successful
  8. Navigate to the PCI devices page
  9. Validate that the PCI devices page is populated/populating with PCI devices

Pre-requisite Enable vGPU

This can only be ran on a bare metal Harvester cluster that has an Nvidia card that support vGPU. You will also need the Nvidia KVM driver and the Nvidia grid installer. These can be downloaded from Nvidia through your partner portal as outlined here
